attributes.title: Data You Can Use

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value:
1. For our use case, 80% of the traffic was net new.
2. Of the 20% we already had, a significant correlation was present to opportunities which shows value in the remaining 80%. This is continuing to test out positively.
3. The total traffic was way too much to use (1k+ unique companies every few months with conversion rates below 2%), but thankfully you can see exactly what each company is looking at. Sorting unique hits by page type, and then seeing which page types correlates to opportunities, allows me to handpick a workable amount of net new Leads to deliver to my sales team which convert at a forecast of over 12% (average). Not bad for Leads we haven't even touched!

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value:
My biggest hurtle with G2 was the Leads integration. I was told I "could get the data any way I wanted" prior to buying. When installing, and realizing it was missing this key feature, I pinged the team. They're still a little young, and therefore overpromised. 

However, this turned out to be a very positive experience, because they designed and implemented a new API specific to my needs, and fast. Turns out they could get it to me any way I wanted, I just had to wait a few weeks. I now have a Leads API that gets me the data, how and when I need it. They're already listening to the next product advancements, and I feel confident the product will continue to grow beyond its existing value, which is already at this point quite significant.

The team was fast, effective, and easy to work with during the update; Couldn't be happier. G2 boyscout here, if you're charged with Demand Generation, Lead Generation, Scoring, or most anything relevant with Leads - there's a way for you to leverage this data and get value by the boat load.

recommendations.text: Recommendations to others considering the product:
recommendations.value:
Get a test data set. Forecast the ROI before making the investment.
Do they have the traffic you need? (size, industry, etc.)
How much of it is unique and net new? (run the domains through your CRM)
How much of it correlates to Opps that you can use? (of those that match, which relate to Opps, are many DQ'd?)

Take what you know of the Accounts that matched in your CRM, lay it over the Accounts that didn't (net new), forecast what you could get out of the net new based on the conversion rates by page type, company size, etc.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value:
Too many to list here, but i'll cover the basics:
1. Mapping data points with high correlations to Opps onto existing Accounts & routing them (behavioral scoring)
2. Importing Net New companies with activity on data points with high correlations to Opps and routing them (lead gen)
3. Identifying existing customers looking into the space to identify churn (churn prevention)
4. Coming Soon - coloring in the Account. G2 has clearbit data, and the moment they finish porting everything into Salesforce i'll be using this to fill in if the company is the right fit via size, funding, etc. (demographic scoring)

love.text: What do you like best about the product?

I primarily use the buying signals to decide which company to reach out to and which team to reach out to based on buying behavior, but I also use the signals for retention purposes. attributes.title: Solid platform with excellent site features and customer service

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value: The personal touch from account reps and teams was amazing from day one. They were super helpful and proactively walked me through the process of getting started and figuring out my questions. The website is by far one of the best websites I've used for admin and features. Love the website and it's the poster-child for usability, tooltips and being well organized.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value: We're really not seeing much as far as leads or traction from the platform as we'd like, but I was warned that G2 is not a big lead generating platform. We hope that the reviews are helping to feed other organic channels, but we'll never really know. I also don't like that they cap the amount of leads they're willing to give you each year, even though extra leads might be coming in. That sounds silly. But, my problem is getting even close to that number to begin with.

recommendations.text: Recommendations to others considering the product:
recommendations.value: Don't expect a ton of traffic or lead volume. For whatever reason this lead volume form G2 is significantly less than other review sites such as Capterra/GetApp/Software Advice, Best Company, Trust Radius, and similar sites. For the price, we should be getting at least 16 leads a month to be comparable to the average across my portfolio of 10 review sites (most of which are free). We have received 2 so far in 4 weeks. We hope this will improve in the months ahead as our profile gains more traction.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: We're a new company so gathering reviews and establishing a 3rd party presence is what we were hoping to accomplish. Getting there.

recommendations.text: Recommendations to others considering the product:

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?

attributes.title: Cutting through the noise

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value:
In the last 12 months, our Salesforce CPQ Grid position has been my go-to slide for demonstrating our customers success with prospects. Its one thing to deliver the company talk track around ease of use, speed, and functionality -- its another to reinforce the story with authentic G2 reviews that are collected from users just like them. 

As a best practice, I strongly recommend leveraging G2 reviews to authenticate your sales conversations. The market we work in can get extremely competitive and its important to cut through the noise, quickly. I do this by sending prospects to a reputable source of truth on how users are getting value from what we provide.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value: The fact that I can't actually see the contact details of the people reviewing our pages

attributes.title: Third-Party Validation You Can't Get Anywhere Else

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value: What I like best about G2 is that we're able to leverage our happy customers as a competitive advantage in sales cycles. Using G2, we can show our prospects a side-by-side comparison of how satisfied our customers are against each of our major competitors. These quantitative metrics have made a huge difference for us.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value: Overall, I like the way G2 looks at markets, but the way that G2 calculates "Market Presence" the Y-axis in Grid Reports  could use some improvement. It uses 15 factors like Number of Employees, Revenue, Web Presence, and  Social Presence. This gives large companies with hundreds of products and thousands of employees a distinct advantage over specialists that are better known in a given market. Companies like IBM and Microsoft will always score well in Market Presence because of their sheer size, even if they have only a handful of employees working on a given product.

recommendations.text: Recommendations to others considering the product:
recommendations.value: If you have lots of happy customers and want to leverage them in sales cycles, this is a great way to do that.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: G2 has allowed us to shorten our sales cycles and help eliminate weaker competitors from our sales cycles.  This translates directly into higher revenue.

attributes.review_source: Organic review. This review was written entirely without invitation or incentive from G2, a seller, or an affiliate.

attributes.title: Great Platform for Collecting Reviews

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value: It was seamless to get up and running with G2 Crowd.  Ali was essential in helping us figure out a game plan to increase our presence on this site and listened to the approach that we wanted to take.  I loved that we could have unique landing pages for our CS team to track inbound reviews and our customers seemed more open to posting reviews knowing they could post anonymously. I also really like being able to customize a reference page that we can keep relevant with recent reviews so that our sales team can leverage this in their conversations.  Having a personal dashboard where you can track all reviews, their status on posting as well as the reward payout is also a plus.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value: Some of our customers did express some frustration with getting the reviews to post, but it most likely was due to user error (not completing email verification or wanting to connect via LinkedIn).  While we did try and coach customers through this, some were not willing to take these additional steps and in turn, caused the reviews not to be posted.  There also was not an exact match for our industry within the drop down list, so sometimes our customers were unsure how to correctly complete all fields that were required.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: This tool is helping us increase our presence in the market and providing another tool that our prospective customers can utilize when making a business decision.

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value: The G2 admin portals are intuitive and easy to use so as an admin, I can find the insights I need without breaking a sweat. That said, the Success and Support teams have been what makes G2 really stand out. There is always a responsive person available to help brainstorm, troubleshoot, or point our program in the right direction.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?

Some features that are truly standard to operate basic review programs seem to only be included in optimized or enhanced packages. It's frustrating to design a program around these limitations and when this is brought up, the only real solution is up-sell - which is not a realistic option for many.

recommendations.text: Recommendations to others considering the product:

Using G2 we have been able to identify trends in client champions (and pain points). Leveraging reviews, we are now having conversations that improve client relationships and create stronger business partnerships.

attributes.title: Great platform to leverage customer feedback

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value:
I really have enjoyed working with the team at G2. They make the onboarding process very easy, provide a lot of useful information and are there when you need help. The G2 platform is very easy-to-use and it's a great way to leverage valuable customer feedback. 

We aim to look at Buyer Intent within the foreseeable future as we see this as being a great way to provide out outbound sales teams with warmer prospects to contact.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value: I can't see any negatives so far so we are looking forward to using the G2 platform more in the future.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: We are using the platform to improve our brand awareness and we then aim to use this more for lead generation. I did a thorough review of comparable platforms and G2 Crowd is definitely the best one on the market.

attributes.title: G2 Helps Promote Business

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value:
G2 assists in sharing information about our product.  It's great that valid users are the ones reviewing the product so that others can benefit from what it has to offer.

Working with the staff at G2 has been nothing less than stellar.  Everyone is readily available to answer questions and they always help you get the most out of their services.  If they see you aren't utilizing a feature you are paying for, they take time to show you how it works and why it's good for your business.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value: Nothing.  The website UI has been an upgrade and makes it even easier to get what you need.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: Spreading the word about our product and how it compares to others in the same category.

love.value: The team was very responsive, fabulous with follow-up, quick to hop on the phone.Appreciate all the hand holding to get things to the finish line. Definitely a fabulous personable team with great tech.

attributes.title: Deepest Funnel Intent on the Market

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value: I love seeing who's looking at our reviews, it gives our sales team a huge advantage but it also helps our CS team retain our current clients.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value: I wish there were more categories. The category we're in is too broad, we have several vendors who have very different offerings and actually a few clients who show up as competitors.

recommendations.text: Recommendations to others considering the product:
recommendations.value: Make sure you have a clear plan to execute against the data. It's only as good as make it, and it took us a few months to figure out how to operationalize the data correctly but now that we have, we can't live without it.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: G2 allows us to know who's shopping for a tool like ours which ensures we have a seat at the table.

attributes.title: Great for advocacy

love.text: What do you like best about the product?
love.value: The tradeshow review service is fantastic. We recently hosted a large conference and had a review station in our customer lounge for them to share love. We've gotten a ton of reviews and customers said they really liked the experience.

hate.text: What do you dislike about the product?
hate.value: Honestly nothing. It's a great service and we're happy customers.

benefits.text: What problems is the product solving and how is that benefiting you?
benefits.value: We are solving for the challenge of getting more diverse customer stories told on G2. Having a physical station for customers to leverage has helped ramp up the total number.
